body:
### Problem

Triggering the new built-in LSP autocompletion always does fuzzy matching on the completion item [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/0ba388847417b8aed469976acf94f9633cb03f15/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua?plain=1#L249).
In case a user is not using `completeopt+=fuzzy`, this yields different result when the completion is automatically filtered and when user triggers it. Here are some examples:

With `completeopt+=fuzzy`:

Having an array in JS, and doing `arr.re`, autotrigger completion gives this:

![screenshot_2024_09_18_15_14_14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/468b08aa-19fa-409a-ad39-52cadd948f31)

When I do `<C-e>` to cancel completion, and then do a manual `.trigger()`, I get this:

![screenshot_2024_09_18_15_14_24](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b21cfbaa-39f9-4390-a945-4d70c81d995a)

"As you type" filtering seems generally smarter than doing `matchfuzzy`, but I understand why `entries` appears.
Ideally, we would have things sorted by the fuzzy matching score, but that is probably a discussion for another time.

Now, Without the `fuzzy` in the `completeopt`:

This is what autotrigger gives:
![screenshot_2024_09_18_15_18_35](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a973c072-8054-4720-98b7-7e7dc5188604)

And this is if I cancel and trigger manually:
![screenshot_2024_09_18_15_19_05](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640ab29f-3e4f-452f-9b03-4e2d41c05d14)


Both `entries` and `forEach` should not appear in this case.

### Expected behavior

In case `completeopt` doesn't have `fuzzy`, filtering should be done strictly, from the start of the string. Basically, this:

```lua
    matches = function(item)
      local text = item.filterText or item.label
      return vim.startswith(text, prefix)
    end
```

This change still gives a bit of different results in the manual completion, but it is more correct:

![screenshot_2024_09_18_15_23_39](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95741854-4032-44e5-ab4d-a90d8bdae8c0)


I'm not sure how `smartcase`, `ignorecase` and other options should play with this, but the general idea is to do more strict matching without `fuzzy` in `completeopt`.
title: [lsp,completion] Do fuzzy matching only if `completeopt` has `fuzzy` in it
